question: If <katex>$v_p, L_p, r_p$</katex> and <katex>$v_a, L_a, r_a$</katex> are radii, velocities and angular momenta of a planet at perihelion and aphelion of its elliptical orbit around the Sun respectively, then
explanation: Angular momentum is conserved in planetary motion: <katex>$L_p = L_a$</katex>. [cite: 127, 128]
Perihelion is the point closest to the sun, so <katex>$r_p < r_a$</katex>. [cite: 129, 130]
Since angular momentum <katex>$L = mvr$</katex> is constant, <katex>$mv_p r_p = mv_a r_a$</katex>. [cite: 131]
